c74object.name: ears.writetags
c74object.description: Writes id3 and id3v2 metadata tags to mp3 files

inlet.description: The ID3V1 or ID3V2 field name followed by the associated tag value For ID3V2 this is a 4-letter character combination, while for ID3V1 it is one of the following symbols: "artist", "year", "album", "title", "comment", "track". Multiple tags can be assigned by wrapping them in levels of parentheses. Which tags are set and whether they are synchronized between versions is handled via the various attributes.
The filename or filenames to which metadata should be set

method.name: clear
method.description: A clear message removes all the ID3V1 and ID3V2 tags (if the id3v1 and id3v2 attributes are on). An optional integer argument (1 or 2) limits the removal to the ID3V1 or ID3V2 tags respectively. If further optional arguments are given, these are expected to be one or several of the four-letter symbols (see http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0 to know more) corresponding to the fields to be cleared; if such arguments are given, any other field will be left untouched.

method.name: clearfirst
method.description: A clearfirst message removes only the first occurrence of a ID3V2 tag with a given four-letter signature. For all other purposes use clear

method.name: read
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet writes some ID3V1 or ID3V2 tags. Such llll is expected to be a list of tags in the form (tag content), (tag content)..., where each tag is an ID3V1 or ID3V2 tag and content is its corresponding value to be set. Tags for ID3V1 can be one of the following symbols: "artist", "title", "album", "year", "comment", "track"; tags for ID3V2 files are four-letter symbols: see http://id3.org/id3v2.3.0 to know more.
An llll in the second inlet sets the file or the list of files to which the tags should be set.

attribute.name: id3v1
attribute.description: When set to 1, handles ID3V1 tags.

attribute.name: id3v2
attribute.description: When set to 1, handles ID3V2 tags.

attribute.name: numericufid
attribute.description: When set to 1, treats unique file ID fields ('UFID') as numeric. This will prevent filling up Max symbol table if a lot of IDs are used.

attribute.name: protect
attribute.description: When set to 1, it protects against non-MP3 file tagging, i.e. it only allows tagging of files ending with the "mp3" extension. This is handy to avoid unwanted tagging of non-mp3 files, which might cause file corruption.

attribute.name: sync
attribute.description: When set to 1, it enhances synchronization between ID3V1 and ID3V2 tags.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: When set to 1, outputs errors in the Max window.

c74object.discussion: The source code uses the id3lib library to handle mp3 metadata.
